medical_history.chief_complaint: Five patients with biochemical and clinical evidence of generalized glucocorticoid resistance.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms varied between patients. One female patient presented with hirsutism and menstrual irregularities at age 18. Another, a girl with severe asthma, had been on prednisone for 2 years, requiring increasing dosages without relief. Additional patients reported fatigue, irregular menstruation, acne, and hirsutism overcoming a timeline from initial presentations to subsequent evaluations of cortisol receptor characteristics.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patients had histories of various hormonal and metabolic issues, including pituitary-dependent Cushing's syndrome, steroid-resistant asthma, and adrenal related conditions. One patient had previously undergone adrenal surgery. Specific past medical histories include obesity and insulin resistance.
medical_history.family_history: The family of Patient 2 showed a normal cortisol suppression in the 1-mg overnight dexamethasone suppression test, although some relatives carried a polymorphism in the glucocorticoid receptor gene without clinical CR signs.
